00039 #pragma once
00040 
00041 #include "gateway/networkmessage.h"
00042 #include "thread.h"
00043 
00044 #ifndef NO_RODOS_NAMESPACE
00045 namespace RODOS {
00046 #endif
00047 
00048 /**
00049  * @file linkinterface.h
00050  * @date 2009/05/01 7:07
00051  * @author Sergio Montenegro
00052  *
00053  * Copyright 2009 DLR
00054  *
00055  * @brief subscribers as gateway
00056  *
00057  */
00058 
00059 /**
00060  * Interface class providing methods to connect to networks or hardware
00061  * interfaces and to enable data transfer.
00062  * The implementation is network dependent and MUST be done in derived
00063  * classes specific to the platform.
00064  */
00065 class Linkinterface  {
00066 
00067     static int linkidentifierCounter;
00068 
00069 protected:
00070 
00071     /// Gateway which has to be connected to the network / interface.
00072     const long linkIdentifier;
00073     Thread* threadToResume;
00074 
00075 public:
00076     bool isBroadcastLink;
00077 
00078     /**
00079      * @brief   Constructor
00080      * @param   linkId  Unique identifier for the link within this node. 0 is
00081      *                                  reserved for local broadcast messages, any other value
00082      *                                  will do. Used to determine from which link a message
00083      *                                  was received.
00084      */
00085     Linkinterface(long linkId) : linkIdentifier((linkId<0) ? linkidentifierCounter++ : linkId) {
00086         isBroadcastLink = false;
00087         threadToResume=0;
00088     }
00089     virtual ~Linkinterface() { }
00090 
00091     /** To initialize the hardware and to establish physical interfaces.
00092      * Depending on the type of interface set interrupt handlers (UART) or
00093      * select a port (UDP) and init the local node number if possible.
00094      */
00095     virtual void init() {}
00096 
00097 
00098     /**
00099      *Processs all received Data. When a NetworkMessage is complete it returns true
00100      *@param inMsg NetworkMessage to write to. When return false this may contain incomplete Data, so do not touch it
00101      *@param numberOfReceivedBytes When return=true this contains the number of Bytes really received or -1 if it is unknown.
00102      *          Should be ==Networkmessage.numberOfBytesToSend() in case of no error.
00103      */
00104     virtual bool getNetworkMsg(NetworkMessage &inMsg,int32_t &numberOfReceivedBytes)   { return false; }
00105 
00106     /**
00107      * Returns if all buffered Messages have been transmittet on the wire.
00108      * If this returns true the next call to sendNetworkMsg should immetiatly start sending out the new messages.
00109      *
00110      */
00111     virtual bool isNetworkMsgSent()                     { return true; }
00112 
00113     /**
00114      *  Sends NetworkMessage over the Link. May block. When it returns the Message should be send out or have been buffered.
00115      * @param The Message to send
00116      */
00117     virtual bool sendNetworkMsg(NetworkMessage& outgoingMessage) { return true;  }
00118     inline long getLinkdentifier() const                { return this->linkIdentifier; }
00119 
00120     /**
00121      * This Thread is resumed when there is new Data availible and getNetworkMsg should be called
00122      *  or when buffered Messages have been transmittet on the wire.
00123      */
00124     void setThreadToResume(Thread* thread) { this->threadToResume = thread; }
00125 };
00126 
00127 
00128 #ifndef NO_RODOS_NAMESPACE
00129 }
00130 #endif
